subject: Re: [PATCH v14 26/26] mm: zswap: Batched zswap_compress() for compress batching of large folios.

reviews.author: Kanchana Sridhar (author)
reviews.summary: The reviewer thanked the author for addressing their comment and acknowledged that it was already pointed out by another person.

reviews.author: Nhat Pham
reviews.summary: Reviewer Nhat Pham had mixed comments on the patch, initially approving it (LGTM) but later raising concerns about the documentation and the batching logic in zswap_compress().

reviews.author: Yosry Ahmed
reviews.summary: Reviewer Yosry Ahmed raised several concerns about the patch for batched zswap_compress() including unnecessary code, unclear documentation, and a large argument list. He also suggested breaking up the series into smaller patches.

reviews.author: Andrew Morton
reviews.summary: Andrew Morton raised concerns about two patches in the series, specifically 'mm: zswap: Tie per-CPU acomp_ctx lifetime to the pool' and 'mm: zswap: Consistently use IS_ERR_OR_NULL() to check acomp_ctx resources', which throw rejects when applied standalone.

reviews.author: Herbert Xu
reviews.summary: Herbert Xu raised concerns about the zswap patch series, specifically pointing out that one of the patches had already been applied to cryptodev and should be rebased. He also reviewed another patch and suggested fixing a GCC warning.
